title: Orange Ginger carrot soup
directions: Grate the orange to yield two teaspoons of grated zest. Juice the orange to yield 1/2 cup of orange juice. Set aside.
In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the carrots, onions, garlic, and ginger and cook for about six-eight minutes until the onions are golden, stir occasionally.
Add the chicken stock, orange zest and bay leaf and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and cook for about 20 minutes until the carrots are tender, stir occasionally.

Transfer this mixture to a KitchenAid Diamond Blender and pur√©e in batches until smooth. Now transfer back to the saucepan. Stir in the orange juice and season with salt and pepper. Cook over medium heat for about two-three minutes until heated through. Garnish with about two tablespoons of cilantro and parsley. Serve hot!
ingredients: 4 1/2 cups chicken stock, homemade or reduced-sodium canned broth
1 bunch cilantro or fresh parsley, minced
